While I currently support a candidate in a major party, it appears unlikely that they will receive the nomination of that party, but I know this one will be on the ballot. 
 
 Here are a few reasons why I support Pastor Baldwin:
 -Pro-Life, 100%
 -Wants to return to Constitutional Government
 -Wants to restore individual liberty
 -Likes the Gold Standard
 -Non-interventionist foreign policy
 -Phased elimination of the income tax (and the IRS)
 -Has always stood up for his beliefs strongly
 -Wants to restore our borders
 -Is against sovereignty destroying organizations like the UN, WTO, and NAFTA
 
 I know some will say I'm "wasting my vote," but I don't look at it that way. I look at it as a way of supporting my principles, and I'd consider a vote for John Hillbama a wasted vote. Studies have alsofound that voting for minor party candidates is much more effective because they influence the policies of the actual politicians in DC (every vote counts).

 I can't find it right now, but it linked the relative success of socialist Eugene Debs garnering cotes (6% in 1912) led to the implementation of many of his policies, including the progressive income tax and the Federal Reserve.
